name: REQUEST - Build for pvp round level 8-13
author: Amusement

posts.author: Amusement
posts.content:
Alright, firstly I like to call myself Amusement, i recently got into NWN because of Gog, i remember playing the game when i was younger & enjoyed it but i don't think i ever really understood most of it.
I played through the campaign a few times & I've also started to play RP servers mostly, which I've gotten really into because of a friend.

The RP server I'm playing at the moment is quite "daunting" in a way, & very hard to progress, there are barely any items & it's known as a "Low magic setting"
What I'm looking for is a build that can hold its own against other players & somewhat decent in PVE/or not at all.

I'm looking for a melee or ranged build, i like the sound of something like a spell casting fighter (I don't like the thought of roleplaying a cleric so i decided against a cleric which I've been told is powerful aswell) but as i lack the experience I'm not sure if it'd be even possible or viable at all, so that's basically why I'm here, too ask you fine people if you have anything that could help me out.

The level max level on the server is 20, but from what I've seen & been told, getting there is near impossible, & most people are around 8-15, with only a few being as far as level 20.

Any help would be appreciated, if it's not even possible please let me know, thanks.

Edit: It doesn't need to steam roll in PVP, I'm not looking for a godly train of destruction, just something that could possibly hold it's own against players not prepared or built for PVP.
If any information is needed, just ask I'll try my best to provide.

Came across some information that i didn't know before.

- Classes must be no more than 10 levels apart when multiclassing.

- All prestige classes require an application. (So if the build required it, I'd eventually have to application for it, which i would i guess try for)

- All prestige classes must have at least 5 levels in them

- All prestige classes are available, with the exception of Harper Scout and Purple Dragon Knights; Red Dragon Disciples can only be taken by outlander (e.g. non-native) characters.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
In a low-magic world, spell casters rule, either divine or arcane, unless nerfed. Here are some other ideas:
Human Monk 20, DEX-base, unarmed
Human Rogue 8 / Fighter 12, STR-based
Halfling Rogue 14 / Fighter 6, DEX-based dual-wielding
Dwarf Fighter 10 / Dwarven Defender 10
Elf Fighter 8 / Wizard 2 / Arcane Archer 10
Human Fighter 12 / Weapon Master 8
Human Bard 14 / Fighter 6
This is far from an exhaustive list.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
May I ask the name of the server, just in case it is somewhere I've played?
Some people om RP servers frown upon power builds. Personally, I think there is nothing wrong with roleplaying strong characters, as long as building for power does not take focus away from the roleplay.
Casters are the strongest characters in low magic environments.
If you for some reason have problems roleplaying a cleric, other options are druids, bards, sorcerers and wizards.
Shifters can be quite strong, as can paladins.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I have played a bit on Ravenloft. The playerbase there has an amazing commitment to the RP. But there is plenty of opportunity for PvM - and PvP as long as the conflict is based on actual RP.
As for build advice: The server is low magic and the encounters are generally difficult and geared towards playing in groups. Playing a caster is definitely easier, even though soloing can be difficult even then.
The characters there get more feats than normal "so you don't have to choose" between picking feats for power- or roleplay reasons. There are several custom feats and even custom skills. So it is difficult to come up with specific builds.
You are not allowed to multiclass monks and paladins.

Are there any kinds of Fighter/Wizard type builds that are decent?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Amusement wrote:Are there any kinds of Fighter/Wizard type builds that are decent?

=D
Fighter/Wizard builds suffer from a diluted stat spread, lower AB and lower spell penetration and spell DC than pure builds. They tend to mature late in epic levels, and will never be "best" at anything. For lvl 1-20 or 8-13 as indicated in the topic title, it is better to focus on either being a melee character or a mage.
In a low magic setting a wizard will be stronger than a fighter once you start to get any significant spells, and a fully buffed wizard will actually be a strong melee character (see the "Melee mage")

The cleric, druid and bard classes in NWN are designed to be self buffing "fighters".
